name: Isosorbide Mononitrate
indications: isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets indicated prevention angina pectoris due coronary artery disease . onset action oral isosorbide mononitrate sufficiently rapid product useful aborting acute anginal episode .
contraindications: recommended starting dose isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets 30 mg ( given single 30 mg tablet 1/2 60 mg tablet ) 60 mg ( given single tablet ) daily . several days , may increased 120 mg ( given single 120 mg tablet two 60 mg tablets ) daily . rarely , 240 mg may required . daily dose isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets taken morning arising . isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets chewed crushed swallowed together half-glassful fluid . break 30 mg tablet .
warningsAndPrecautions: isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets , usp 30 mg white , biconvex oval shaped tablets , scored embossed `` 30 `` one side . ndc : 70518-2122-00 ndc : 70518-2122-01 packaging : 30 1 blister pack packaging : 90 1 bottle , plastic store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ( usp controlled room temperature ) . protect excessive moisture . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: isosorbide mononitrate extended-release tablets contraindicated patients shown hypersensitivity idiosyncratic nitrates nitrites .
indications_original: Isosorbide Mononitrate Extended-Release Tablets are indicated for the prevention of angina pectoris due to coronary artery disease. The onset of action of oral isosorbide mononitrate is not sufficiently rapid for this product to be useful in aborting an acute anginal episode.
contraindications_original: The recommended starting dose of Isosorbide Mononitrate Extended-Release Tablets is 30 mg (given as a single 30 mg tablet or as 1/2 of a 60 mg tablet) or 60 mg (given as a single tablet) once daily. After several days, the dosage may be increased to 120 mg (given as a single 120 mg tablet or as two 60 mg tablets) once daily. Rarely, 240 mg may be required. The daily dose of Isosorbide Mononitrate Extended-Release Tablets should be taken in the morning on arising. Isosorbide Mononitrate Extended-Release Tablets should not be chewed or crushed and should be swallowed together with a half-glassful of fluid. Do not break the 30 mg tablet.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Isosorbide Mononitrate Extended-Release Tablets, USP 30 mg are White, biconvex oval shaped tablets, scored and embossed "30" on one side.
                  NDC: 70518-2122-00
                  NDC: 70518-2122-01
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE, PLASTIC
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) (see USP Controlled Room Temperature). Protect from excessive moisture.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Isosorbide Mononitrate Extended-Release Tablets are contraindicated in patients who have shown hypersensitivity or idiosyncratic reactions to other nitrates or nitrites.
